intro: Hieracium epeonium, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright purple to reddish flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium epeonium is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun.
